intro: Carmichaelia violacea, commonly known as the violet broom, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Carmichaelia violacea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
